results.title: Caninabis
results.creator_credit: Kaj Pindal, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Caninabis is an animated film about a dog whose brilliant career on the drug squad collapses when he mistakes a truckload of fertilizer for marijuana, causing an uncalled-for “bust”. He is the victim of “burn-out”, brought on by protracted smoking of drugs. The film’s message is clear: smoking marijuana is definitely not good for dogs. Award: Zagreb.

results.title: Candleshoe
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An adventure story about a noble lady and her orphans fighting to remain in their mansion after being threatened with eviction if the estate taxes are not paid. Lady St Edmund (Helen Hayes), aware of the legend about one of her ancestors supposedly having hidden a treasure of gold coins somewhere in the mansion, unwittingly finds herself a victim of a set-up by two unscrupulous characters, Bundage (Leo McKern) and Grimsworthy (Vivian Pickles), who also want to find the hidden money. Plotting and scheming the pair persuade a young urchin Casey (Jodie Foster), to help them by posing as Lady St Edmund’s long-lost granddaughter. Features David Niven as Priory, Lady St Edmund’s butler, gardener, chauffeur and right-hand man.

results.title: Candide Ou L'optimisme (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
He (Voltaire) is best remembered for the tale Candide (1759), a savage denunciation of metaphysical optimism (“all is for the best in the best of all possible worlds”) that reveals a world of horrors and folly. In Candide’s characters the instinct of survival remains uppermost however, and provides a ray of hope in an otherwise sombre scene. Candide at last renounces absolute truths as futile and settles for the simple life of “cultivating his garden.” Reference: Encyclopedia Britanica. Online. http://www.britanica.com

Credits: Producer, director, Pierre Cardinal ; writer, Pierre Cardinal ; photography, Jacques Lemarc ; music, Marcel Landowski.
Cast: Daniel Emilfork, Bernard Dheran, Claude Nicot, Anne Doat, Robert Vattier, Leonce Corne.

results.title: Canaries to clydesdales
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A view of the practice of veterinary partners working in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. Thirty thousand miles of house calls a year is routine for these two country veterinarians whose patients include just about any creature that hops, trots, swims or flies. This film follows Doctors Vic Demetrick and Reg Maidment through the daily rounds that take them from sterile clinic to farm paddock. The devoted vets obviously relish their work. They display an enormous warmth and respect for each other, their animal patients, and their human clients. “Canaries to Clydesdales” shows that it takes compassion, commitment, and a strong dose of humour to succeed in this profession. After seeing this veterinary team at work, the career-minded will have the personal insight to evaluate their own qualifications. Awards: New York; Birmingham

results.title: Canadian profile
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An informal portrait of the people of Canada at a time when modern technology is reaching into every phase of national life. Beginning with the fishermen of Newfoundland and ending with the Kitimat project on the west coast, the film explores the demands of a new machine age on people of diverse origins in whom the feeling for tradition is strong. In all there is evidence of change, adjustment, adaption as the industrial expansion becomes increasingly accelerated. Award: Toronto

results.title: Canadian geography. No. 1. Physical regions of Canada
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the physical and economic geography of Canada on the basis of six natural divisions: the Pacific Coast region, the Great Plains, the Laurentian Shield, the St. Lawrence Lowlands, the Atlantic region and the Arctic Islands. In each region the film interprets the relationship of topography, climate and natural resources to the industries or occupations of its inhabitants.

results.title: Cancer in women
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Wright, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A self-help film designed to convince women of the need for regular physical check-ups to detect and counter early symptoms of cancer. The cost of neglect is high, and the film presents ample and convincing evidence: what is shown is strong medicine, and intentionally so— the malignant growths, the ugly scars, the excised tumours. The procedures followed in examination for cancer are shown.

results.title: Canadian wheat story
results.creator_credit: Beth Zinkan, Gudrun Parker, Bill MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the story of what happens to the great wheat crops of western Canada after the harvest. The route is traced from the farm to the town elevator, by box car to the huge concrete storage cylinders at terminal points on the Great Lakes, down the Lakes to the homes and bakeries of eastern Canada, and to the ocean ports for shipment abroad.

results.title: Canada wild
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Grainger Maynard
results.brief_description: This adventure records the superb wildlife and wilderness of outback Canada, beginning in the stunning Queen Charlotte Islands, the Galapagos of North America. We sail past foraging bears, whales, raccoons, seals and sea lions, catching Coho Salmon in the land Haida Indians. The action then moves to the Rocky Mountains with a spectacular horse trek and white water rafting in the famous raging rapids. We then travel to Baffin Island in the Arctic Circle to hunt caribou and seal with the Inuit Indians - the Canadian Eskimos. It is a wonderful journey through the beautiful and remote Canadian wilderness.

results.title: Canada vignettes: Log driver's waltz
results.creator_credit: John Weldon, Derek Lamb, David Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A young girl who loves to dance and is ready to marry chooses a log driver over his more well-to-do, land-loving competition. Driving logs down the river has made him the best dancing partner to be found. This lighthearted, animated tale is based on the song The Log Driver’s Waltz by Wade Hemsworth. Kate and Anna McGarrigle sing to the music of the Mountain City Four.
